description: From Latin lātifundium, from lātus (“wide, extensive”) + fundus (“ground, base, estate, farm”).

entries.meaning: (chiefly in the plural) A great landed estate with absentee ownership and labor often in a state of partial servitude.
examples: His vision for the future of the African continent in the Age of the Aerotropolis seems to be as a vast latifundium sown with GM wheat.
